name: Holiday Inn Express Deforest

reviews.text: Evening of June 25, 2013: Clean motel, nice amenities, and good customer service provided by the staff. The complimentary breakfast was more extensive than those typically provided by other motels. Added bonus: the Ehlenbach Cheese Chalet across the street - worth a visit (many different Wisconsin food items).
reviews.title: Good service

reviews.text: This was a one week business stay. I would classify this Hotel as an average Holiday Inn Express. No problems, but nothing spectacular either.
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: The Hotel is situated about ¼ mile from the Interstate, with convenience stores, and a few small restaurants nears by. It’s more or less a truck stop area.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, cookie-cutter HI Express, executed flawlessly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are medium size with microwave & fridge, Large Flat screen. The channel guide shows 98 channels, but a lot of them have no signal. The work area leaves a lot to be desired. A small table in the corner with a semi comfortable chair, and a single electrical outlet a couple of feet away. The microwave & fridge are in a tall cabinet that totally blocks your view of the TV. You need to be in the bed to see the TV. AC / Heat is quiet and effective, and the free internet connection is reliable.
reviews.title: On the road

reviews.text: The bed was clean and comfortable, and I got a good nights sleep. The room was also quiet.
reviews.title: Perfect location and very helpful staff!

reviews.text: I stayed here during the summer for a wedding. Right from the start I felt welcome and at home. Colleen checked me in and she was very quick and super friendly. We didn't show up until late and she was already at the front desk when we walked in; ready to go. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was awesome! Eggs, Pancakes & Bacon were my favorite! They also had really good cinnamon rolls! I would highly suggest this hotel for your wedding party or anyone looking for a high quality room & hotel with all the amenities; right off the interstate! Super close to Madison!
reviews.title: Great Service. Exquisite hotel!

reviews.text: This is our new stopping point between Minneapolis and Toledo. The staff is friendlier than anywhere we've been, the room was clean and the breakfast was good, the lady that brings in her own baked goods is a real blessing, and a great baker and candy maker, looking forward to our next stop. Thank You.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Clean room, small swimming pool area , not enough tables and chairs with very small dining area and few choices of breakfast meal. Single and slow elevator. This is not a typical Holiday inn express...short handed by far. The parking area smells like a barnyard nothing exciting within the surrounding area. Would rather stay at another hotel across the highway.
reviews.title: Holidayless Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reserved a King size whirlpool suite and got room 127 which has a king size bed and whirlpool but not a "sofa in a separate seating area" as described on their website. Room is on the other side of the stairwell and is as noisy as the people running up and down the stairs. Room decor was comfortable but dated. Bathroom area is small, exhaust fan noisy but sink/tub drained fast. Pool was closed but that wasn't stated on their website. Staff was nice but not friendly except the lady who worked in the breakfast area who was so friendly her work suffered - food items were limited or ran out. Internet access was not reliable. BTW, I sent an e-mail to guest relations and got a "form e-mail" in reply with a Case# but no response from the DeForest management. Definitely would not stay here again - the Holiday Inn Express' in Madison are much nicer.
reviews.title: King size whirlpool suite?

reviews.text: My husband travels weekly for work. I joined him this time for a quick trip. After driving 11 hours, I could have slept in a gravel pit. Instead, we ended up at his favorite chain, HI. I was happy with the room. It had a clean bed and bathroom. That is all I needed last night. Today, I can explain further why I gave it a four not a five. The room was equiped with all the Ammenities the H I chain usually has. The bathroom was very small. The sink is outside the bathroom which is not usual for this type of hotel. The sink and counter were postage stamp small. My husband stated this is too unusual for this type hotel. Bed was comfortable, (but as I said I was tired!) Room is nice and clean, bathroom clean. Breakfast was fine. The usual H.I. Things with a good variety.
reviews.title: needed a bed fast
Kids Loved the "Kids Suite"
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night after a wedding. Very convenient location just off Hwy I-94. My kids loved the "kids suite" which was a very large room with a king size bed for us and bunk beds and a TV in a separate alcove for them. Bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. Did not eat breakfast or use the pool due to time constraints.

This was a stop-over on our way from Chicago to Minneapolis. It was an average place, nothing really outstanding to speak of but nothing to complain about either. Room was clean and tidy. Breakfast in the morning was fine. No complaints, booked the room in advance (non- refundable) and got it for less than $100. For that price, the place was pretty good but overall just an average HI Exp.
reviews.title: Pretty Typical HI Express

reviews.text: Michael, Michael, Michael! Thank you so very much for your most helpful service on our way through WI. We were lost. Saw your hotel and being very tired and cranky, decided to stop for the night. We were greeted by Michael who had a big smile for us. He was very helpful in directions as to where we were and as to where we needed to be the next day. He got us quickly set up with a room and a feeling that we picked the right place to get lost. We slept well and were off the next day with directions that did not fail. THANK YOU TO Michael for your kindness and patience.
reviews.title: Front Desk Help

reviews.text: We stay there every now and again if the Dells is full,its 30miles but saves a little money.Got checked in by a tattooed hippy in her street clothes and breakfast lady was proud of her chest tattoo too,big city living i guess. It was $130 but only worth that if you go to the Dells where it can top $200. Rooms were ok,quiet but can smell like manure from the neighboring farms.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.text: Thank you for the wonderful stay at your hotel. I wanted to give a shout out to your night auditor who went the extra mile and left the pool open for my kids to swim a little bit longer, I do believe his name is Michael. Very clean rooms, and a great breakfast! If we are back in the area I will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Very Clean

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location if you want to stay near Madison but don't want to pay higher Madison prices. It is an IDEAL hotel if you are driving from the Twin Cities to Chicago and want to stay overnight in Madison (like if you leave Friday night after work and want to drive part way to Chicago....you can stay here and then its only about a 3 hour drive the next morning).
reviews.title: Good location and price, but hotel smaller than most Holiday Inn Expresses

reviews.text: The prices here are generally one level lower than the same class hotels in Madison. It is just off the highway at the DeForest exit so you don't even have to go into Madison and can get back on the highway to finish your trip easily.
reviews.title: Not great service, but room was nice.

reviews.text: There are quite a few fast food places at this exit, so there's a good variety to choose from for quick meals.
reviews.title: Nice, clean right off freeway

reviews.text: The hotel itself is a bit smaller than most Holiday Inn Expresses and it is quite a bit older than most of the new ones. Because of this, some of the areas look a little dated and the rooms are significantly smaller than other Holiday Inn Expresses. An example of this is that the sink area is immediately inside the entry door....a bit awkward.
reviews.title: NICE

reviews.text: The bathroom was a little cramped as well but everything worked well and the amenities are great smelling, albeit a bit small.
reviews.title: Good place to stay

aka: Holiday Inn Express Deforest Hotel De Forest
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Deforest/Madison, conveniently located at I-90 and County V, exit 126 offering excellent Interstate access and visibility. The Holiday Inn Express Deforest/Madison is just minutes from the Dane County Regional Airport and Truax Field. Close to major corporate offices including ABS Global, Evco Plastics, Ball Corporation, Sanamax, and Firestone Building Products. The Holiday Inn Express DeForest/Madison offers complimentary shuttle to Dane County Regional Airport, (advanced reservations needed at least 72 hours prior to arrival) and local corporate offices.The Holiday Inn Express Deforest/Madison is convenient to major Madison destinations such as Camp Randall Stadium, UW Kohl Center, University of Wisconsin Madison Campus, Overture Center for the Arts, Olbrich Botanical Gardens, Madison Monona Terrace Convention Center, Dane County Expo Center, Alliant Energy Center. Located 30 minutes south of Wisconsin Dells, 15 minutes from Cascade Ski Hill, 30 minutes from Devils Head Ski Area.The Holiday Inn Express DeForest/Madison offers excellent guest service from a friendly staff of professionals. The entire hotel has recently been remodeled with beautiful guestroom furniture, including mattresses and box springs.
